frameDefinitions: An Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it.
A Person or Institution is being described in terms of their wealthiness, in other words the amount of money in their possession.
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
A State_of_affairs is evaluated as good (or bad), against a background assumption that previously, the State_of_affairs was thought to be unlikely to occur.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
Words in this frame name medical conditions or diseases that a patient suffers from, is being treated for, may be cured of, or die of.
frameExamples: In the 1920s the peach industry <t>flourished</t> in Upson County.
This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
listRoleDefinitions: The <t>Entity</t> is experiencing a period of desirable events or states.
This role describes the state of the <fen>Entity</fen>. It is often incorporated into the LUs of this frame.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> thrives.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the thriving takes place.
The individual or individuals whose wealthiness is being described.
A group which has (or lacks) possession of some resource.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The State of affairs that is evaluated.
The Protagonist is the one for whom the destiny is evaluated.
The <fen>Role</fen> filled by the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The time for which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s destiny is good.
The location where the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has luck.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
This role is used for the patient, entity, or population (originally) affected by the condition or illness.
FN: Any medical problem.
The location where the <fen>Ailment</fen> is effecting the <fen>Patient</fen>s.
listRoleExamples: In the 1920s <fex>the peach industry</fex> thrived in Upson County.
He was living <fex>well</fex> after his promotion.
<fex>In the 1920s</fex> the peach industry thrived in Upson County.
Why was it that democracy flourished <fex>in America</fex>?
<fex>Pat and Kim</fex> are completely broke at the moment.
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
I was rather fortunate <fex>in the late 90s</fex>, making much of my fortune at that time.
The football referee's controversial call led to a bloody free-for-all <fex>among the fans</fex>.
I couldn't help but watch as several bruised people reentered the <fex><t>melee</t></fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Theory of the Leisure Class
